item.title: Ticket #300 (Blank settings when using ?showoptions=all get changed to "0") updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
I went back to 1.2's options table and made an array out of all values with option_type of 3 (text values that should NOT be set to "0" if blank, but instead set to "" (blank!)

I removed the option_type check code that shouldn't still be there, and replaced it with a check of the array of "text" options.

I've tested, and it seems to work as it should.

This seems to fix it for the all options pages including the "secret" /wp-admin/options.php?showoptions=all

item.title: Ticket #300 (Blank settings when using ?showoptions=all get changed to "0") updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Okay, apparently option_type has been depreciated, so they are all supposed to be 1... but unfortunately some code in options.php still requires that they be set. I'm going to take a look at that code and try to get it working.

item.title: Ticket #370 (Add option to prevent comment cookie being saved) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: People who use public computers might not like that WordPress stores their comment data in a cookie. The following patch allows an option to be added to the comment form that will prevent that cookie from being saved.

item.description: Maybe solution would be RewriteRule ([a-zA-Z0-9_-]+)/?$ /index.php?category_name=$1 [QSA]

item.title: Ticket #330 (.htaccess generated for permalinks can cause Server 500 error) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: RewriteRule (.+)/?$ /index.php?category_name=$1 [QSA] leads to unlimited rewrite loop ? then all images, styles etc. links will be passwd to category_name

item.title: Ticket #368 (Extra drafts are created when Advanced Editing is clicked.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: In WP 1.2 or 1.2.1, if I go to the Write screen, click on Advanced Editing, click on View Site and go back to the Write screen, I get a draft message added to Your Drafts. This also happens if I click Edit instead of View Site, etc. It probably does this with other selections.

item.title: Ticket #137 (Comments feed modification time is based on posts, not comments) updated
item.dc:creator: kelson
item.description:
There's been a working fix for this for 3 months and no activity. (And apparently no owner?) On the theory that what's holding it up is the lack of a patch... here's a patch.

I should mention that the severity is higher now than it originally was, because it used to be masked by bug 133. Now that that's fixed, this becomes an issue. If you only post once a week, but several people comment each day, your comments feed will not update for the entire week.

item.title: Ticket #364 (Approving comment via e-mail link generates 2 e-mails to author) closed
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Fixed up.

item.title: Ticket #367 (Feeds do not include language information) created
item.dc:creator: kelson
item.description:
Many feed directories, such as syndic8.com, use the language features of RSS and Atom to aid in searching. These attributes are not present in WordPress' feeds.

For RSS, the tag is in the form (using square brackets instead of angular) [language]enlanguage and is a child of the [feed] element. For Atom, you simply apply the xml:lang="en" attribute to the [feed] element.

item.description: Move get_theme*() from admin-functions to functions so that templates and plugins can use them.

item.title: Ticket #330 (.htaccess generated for permalinks can cause Server 500 error) updated
item.dc:creator: jamesvl
item.description:
One more thing: the rewrite rule doesn't work for categories with a '-' in them. It needs to be changed to:

RewriteRule ([a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,})/?$ /index.php?category_name=$1 [QSA]

for it to work.

item.title: Ticket #365 (time problems and error messages in blogger-import.php when Blogger ...) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When I imported my blogger entries to wordpress, I got several messages saying that there was a duplicate entry. After that, the last_insert_id(); of the wp_posts table was greater than the number of entries saved, althoug there were not more posts than there were in blogger. Also, the posts that was writen on times between 12:00 and 12:59 AM are stored like 12:xx when should be 00:xx.

item.title: Ticket #362 (Users of the same level can edit each others' posts) updated
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description:
My apologies. This bug report is similar to #0000359.

-tin

item.title: Ticket #362 (Users of the same level can edit each others' posts) created
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description:
For example, if there are three authors that all have Level 2 status, each author can edit the other Level 2 authors' posts via the "Edit This" link and through the "Edit Post" link when viewing the "Manage Comments" page.

Any particular author should only be able to edit other authors' posts if his level is higher than them, right? He shouldn't be able to edit the posts of other authors who is at the same level as he.

item.title: Ticket #361 (Database error when viewing posts by Catagory) created
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description:
Using nightly build 10/12/2004:

Whenever you view your posts by Catagory, the following error message displays at the bottom of the page:

Database error: [Unknown column 'category_id' in 'where clause'] SELECT COUNT(ID) FROM wp_posts WHERE 1=1 AND (category_id = 6) AND post_date_gmt <= '2004-10-13 08:14:59' AND (post_status = "publish")

item.title: Ticket #240 (duplicate category names cause DB error even on different category levels) updated
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
this problem still exists as of current cvs

if categories with the same name *aren't* allowed at different levels, then this needs to be handled gracefully instead of the current error/die:

Database error: [Duplicate entry 'articles' for key 2] INSERT INTO wp_working_categories (cat_ID, cat_name, category_nicename, category_description, category_parent) VALUES ('0', 'articles', 'articles', , '3')
